comments.body: I agree. I also think that here should be a different way to obtain their leads and llamas, rather than just killing them.
love the chorus fruit bit
And then not come back for at least 10 game days.
Or add a block that signals to him not to come within a certain area. Like make him avoid soul flame lantern and torches (blue/soul flames in general)

No, el comerciante errante es muy amable, aunque sus intercambios sean malos, al menos nos hace compa√±ia 

Text: ‚ÄúNo, the wandering trader is very kind, even if his exchanges are bad, at least he makes us company‚Äù

- Translated by Admin

I agree, but I would even recommend removing it from the game, because it goes against the purpose of Minecraft: exploration. If I want to find something, I go looking for it, I don't want it to suddenly appear in front of me, it doesn't seem to go well with the atmosphere of the game which is based on adventure. Plus there are already a lot of chests and treasures, we don't need to be facilitated any further. And besides ... anyway ... 70% of minecraft players don't like it.
Like every time i watch a minecraft video and see a wandering traider, i watch them die killed by players.

YES! I'd also like him to come to me every once in a while with something I'd like to buy. And also this.

The wandering trader is almost good, except that when he comes with useless items standing on top of my house, he's just BEGGING for a beating.
i suggest skeleton skulls should be the block to scare the trader away , or let the players be able to give him rottenflesh as sign of disrespect so he knows he isnt welcome (sorry for bad grammer)
yeah this is a genius idea or they should at least make traders useful
Great idea but there should only be one or two knights at illager outposts to keep it balanced
Cool idea
They should protect in Raids the Beast and Block arrows with their shields and can't get thrown by Iron Golems.
There should be a illager knight boss that is like a wandering boss that fits your qualifications but they should also add a illiger warrior that drops chain mail and uses a stone or iron sword.
Give the horse armor
Maybe they should spawn on the highest floor of the woodland mansion
I think that 75% should spawn without horses and 25% should spawn with them, just to make them a little easier to kill.

Maybe a player could manipulate the studying habits somehow so when the villiger grows up they will have certain trades available. Give the pupil unbreaking books and they will be guaranteed to trade unbreaking books as a librarian or unbreaking gear, tools, weapons as tool/weaponsmith.
Yeah, that way the idea that players can just reload workstations can get nerfed and players have to stick with villagers throughout their life to get them the trades the players want.
This will make them more alive. I love it!

Why not to be generated a school in the village? I think it would be nice :), I also think that when daytime reach xxxxx(e.g: 04500) they could run to school and select a random class, and when the daytime reach xxxxx(e.g: 10000) they could exit the school and play with other kids :D
Sounds great. I‚Äôm voting
This sounds like a great idea, but as of now, baby villagers only stay babies for 20 minutes, so the babies would have to be younger for longer for this to work. A school is a good idea for this.
Although yes i agree with you totally. I think piglins are much too greedy to ever share their gold items with one another and thats the only thing they barter with!
I agree with this 100%. And, if you tried to steal one of their items, only those 2 piglins would become hostile, and not any other ones.
I think they should add fools/fake gold and that would be the reason they take awhile to look at the gold when bartering
It's brilliant!

I would like there to be a additional spawn event for the bedrock and java editions for piglins. There is a celebration event for illagers, and if there was a spawn event for piglin celebration then other players could spawn in piglins that are constantly celebrating. This feature would be nice. I would really appreciate it if you added this feature.

I had made a post like this a few days after you, but I hadn't seen yours! I think Zombie Pigmen should be like the brown mooshrooms, just a bit more common. What do you think about that? It's not common, and in your face, but it's rare enough to bring the nostalgia when you see it on rare occasion. Just imagine, it's been a while since you saw the Zombie Pigmen, you've forgotten all about them now, and then you see it, and all the memories come flooding back!
I see what you are saying, and I like that. It balances out the aspect of the intentions of the Minecraft Devs and it keeps the people happy that the mob is still in the game... brilliant!

I 1,000,000% agree with this idea. Its kinda like Zombies and Zombified Villagers, keep the normal Zombie Pigmen as the basic Zombie type of the Nether and have the Zombified Piglins be the type of Piglin that can be infected and become zombified.

I made a post about this as well with the argument that the mobs should stay consistent with each other (which was the intend for this change I think). With fixing the inconsistency between zombie pigman and piglins they created another inconsistency between the group "zombie villagers, villagers and zombies" and the group "zombiefied piglins, piglins and zombie pigman". Just like the zombie villagers (which I thinks should be called zombified villagers now, as to stay consistent you know, and changing zombified piglin to zombie piglin is too similar to zombie pigman) the zombified piglins should be "infected" piglins with a small chance of spawning naturally. Not sure if it makes sense for them to be curable tho, but normal piglins should be able to get infected.

My own post (which was posted before yours) seems to be deleted tho, therefore I am explaining my reasons here (as yours has votes already too, this seems like the most likely place to be noticed).

The Zombie Pigman also resembles an overworld pig so it would seem normal for them to spawn when an overworld pig is struck by lighting. As for zombiefied Piglins they don't resemble an overworld pig at all, they look more like the hoglin. It wouldn't make sense for a Zombified Piglin to spawn when an overworld pig is struck by lightning. Also the Piglins skin changes to bright pink when zombified which was suitable for the Pigman but not for the Piglin as they are darker colored.

I 100% agree with this idea. I think they should also bring back the Generic Pigmen (with original generic pigman design) and have some nether villages be piglin villages while others will be pigmen villages depending on the biome but overworked pigs will still turn into zombie pigmen and zombie pigmen will still be everywhere. Pigmen will be immune to zombification.
Why not make zombie pigman attack piglins and the piglins will turn into zombiefied piglins
I think Zombie Pigman should be rare.
rip pigman

Zombie pigman should be more rare. zombified piglins and zombie pigman attack when you when you attack they both act like current zombified. But also since Piglins basicly are moving on from the long gone pigman they would have to add pigman that trade for rubies since that is what they where supposed to do maybe pigmen would make nether villages and piglins attack pigman like illagers attack villagers
Just bring zombie pigman back
great idea
I just posted the same but my idea was a little more complex but your idea is more simple
If they add back zombie pimen, then they should add back the even older version (regular pigmen) as well. It would nice to see a non-creepy non-gross version of the zombie pigman.
They they should pathfind them selfs to fortresses to have a little scrap with thy wither skeletons.
Piglins could definitely be expanded on. Perhaps wondering Piglin traders that use striders instead of llamas, for instance.
Piglins riding Striders would definitely be nice to see. The patrol thing should also probably happen on land, although I‚Äôm not sure what they‚Äôre patrolling for...

I had this idea as well, but I thought that they could also do some actual placing and breaking blocks. For instance, in the case of a creeper exploding one of the buildings, a carpenter would slowly fix it. The block related to them could also be the wood equivalent of the stonecutter block.

I had the exact same thought of a wood working villager, but I would like to see different variants in wooden doors and trapdoors as well if they ever add a wood worker. And maybe the villager could trade saplings, sticks and leaves for emeralds. I would love that, I have so many sticks and saplings in my survival world. üíö

My thoughts are similar, only with them trading objects made of wood based on their village construction, in a desert they would trade jungle doors, but in snowy tundra it would be spruce doors and so on allowing you to repair and replicate the architecture.

Fantastic suggestion imo.

The only thing that I am constantly needing to grind more of is wooden planks - particularly for chests (eight wood for a single hopper becomes expensive), but as well for building blocks as I love the aesthetic. Where I have nearly everything else automated in my world from iron to melons, WOOD is the only resource that has not been reliably farm-able without making an incredibly complex system of pistons and TNT dupes - let alone needing unlimited saplings and bone-meal. Quite the undertaking. 

Having a woodcutter villager selling chests, planks, saplings and logs would be an incredible asset to my world. Higher tier trades could even include campfires or rarer leaf-types. 

I would also like a villager that I could sell off the large amount of iron axes that I assemble from trading with tool-smiths and weapon-smiths. A woodcutter needs axes, but lets not break the economy by allowing the player to buy an axe from one villager just to trade it to another for your emeralds back. I suggest: Sell an axe *and* some emeralds to a woodcutter for a handful of logs. 

I'm not a fan of restricting wood-types to be biome specific, but instead should be a random roll. This way village management can include shuffling your woodcutter to get the trades you want, like other professions. 

TL;DR: Wood is hard to automate, and I would love to buy it with emeralds.

A new profession means a new job site block:

Like the stone mason have the stonecutter, the wood worker could have the woodcutter which recipe in the crafting grid would be almost the same materials and placing like the stonecutter, but instead 3 stones would be 3 of whether logs, woods, stems and hyphae, stripped or not. Having the same mechanic as the stonecutter that crafts slabs, and stairs (it's supposable to include the walls but there are no walls made of wood; could be fences but neither the nether fences are crafted in the stonecutter) would be a place to craft wood-related blocks in smaller and more precise quantities than crafting.

And I kind of had the idea of it working at station being a side table because making stairs is expensive you can make stone stairs very cheaply but you can't make wood stairs cheaply so if they do add in a woodworking or lumberjack villager they should have the workstation be I saw a table just like there's a stone cutter for Stone

Or instead of a woodcutter just call it a sawmill and make a carpenter profession. Mojang really missed the opportunity with the stonecutter and mason, they could have added the same thing but with wood, and it would've been an even better update. There is no downside to a sawmill. 

ps:(I'm posting this here because I thought about the sawmill and the carpenter profession but couldn't decide in what category to post it, and I know I'm mainly talking about the work station but this is the only place to talk about it that I found)
Yeah that's what I was kind of talking about to I just couldn't think of a good name to call it or really what to call it

Rather than a sawmill or a woodcutter block, why not just make it a chopping block? it would look like a vertical half-log with an axe stuck into it, and maybe some shears on the side. It would be craftable with one wood log and an axe.

Could have a workbench with some chisels on it for a job block. That itself could be a good excuse if Mojang wants to add a block that‚Äôs like the stonecutter, but for wood. I like the idea that these villagers would be patching up the doors when we aren‚Äôt looking.

This could also be an introduction to actual furniture in Minecraft, like tables, chairs, shelving, etc. I'm tired of putting a pressure plate on a fence and calling it a table, and then standing on stairs to sit at it, and having it *click* every time I touch it.
This is a really cool idea me and a lot of other people want to see
The best revival of everybody's childhood...
thats what i have been saying!
I really hope this gets added.
YES YES YES. It‚Äôs a good idea for both the game but also the players
This would be amazing

would be nice to have more Easter eggs in game. always nice when something quirky is added, even if it does seem a bit pointless... 

just look at the things ppl did with upside down animals when they used leads
I legit just had this idea and went to check to see if anyone else had but maybe not just a Liberian  imagine if the jeb name tag only worked on lime green sheep.
PLEASE THIS NEEDS TO BE ADDED
Yes.  100% YES
Is this a real feature?
Great thinking
Thanks!

I like the idea of using clubs to smash away blocks, but there should also be some blocks that cannot be smashed like iron and obsidian. Different types of blocks should have different amounts of time till they are broken (e.g. wood 2 secs, stone 10 secs, gold 4-5 secs and sand and gravel 0.5 secs etc). The trolls could go to the weakest block it can reach to attack an enemy. It would add some realism because you could spawn some outside your castle and they'd actually be able to get inside by smashing through the gates.
Ok, but the trolls are not smart so they would not chose the quickest path to you.
They should live in the mountain biome in some kind of caves what aint deep. And there shold be different types of trolls and they could also throw rocks at you. But its a good idea tho

I think it would be cool if they petrify in the sun thats why they only live in caves and the dark oak forest when they are petrified you can crack them with a pickaxe and then they drop ore the stronger maybe then there are diffrent sorts of trolls for ecry ore except netherrite
They should turn to stone when exposed to daylight. Either temporarily or permanently.
Perhaps the trolls could spawn in caves of specific chunk regions like slimes currently do. The could also spawn in Mountain biomes during a full moon, again like slimes do with swamps.
I like this idea, but they shouldn't be bigger than Iron Golems.
NOICE IDEA.

This would be so cool! I have an idea for a fun easter egg with this idea. Maybe when you ring a bell, trolls will try to flee (like hoglins and piglins with soul torches) for a little while before trying to attack you again. This would reference the Netflix show Hilda, where trolls are repelled by ringing bells.

I love this idea! I have always loved the idea of trolls being in Minecraft. Not necessarily the more modern fantasy one of today but the classical Scandinavian trolls, particularly the nocturnal giants from Norwegian, Swedish, and Icelandic Folklore. They could be giants that would adapt to the overworld biomes, such as swamps, lush caves, mountains, forests, rivers, ice spike, hills, and/or lakes. They could stand 4 blocks tall and 2 blocks wide, with an upright, proportionately slender humanoid frame that features long, thick limbs. They could sport long noses and big ears, and may have up to 3 heads. They can break any blocks as strong as wood or maybe stone blocks, but nothing over obsidian. They may be neutral, but territorial mobs that spawn alone or in a trio at most in their own homes in their respected biome, they also might be able to eat other mobs and/or players, and if exposed to sunlight for too long will have a 50% chance of either bursting into pebble particles or turning into a statue that if mined with a pickax enchanted with silk touch can be collected as a trophy or decoration of sorts.
Trolls should spawn out of a 2x2x2 area of stone from the side of mountains or in caves.
I think this could be a good alternative to the scrapped giant mobs.
Awesome idea! I wonder if trolls could also have a rolling animation like rolling boulders to pathfind to the player.
I RELY LOVE THIS IDEA (:l=
This would be a great idea! (Especially since 1.14 with the new structures in villages they keep getting stuck in their animal pens)

As a way to prevent villagers from going through fence gates, I suggest the addition of Iron Fence gates. Working on the same principle as Iron Doors in needing a redstone singal to operate.

For the villagers being able to decidedly pathfind via ladders would also help villagers acutally fully utilize their homes in the few naturally generated village structures which does generate with ladders. (it has always wondered me why mojang added ladders to some village structures when villagers are incapable of using them correctly)

And for villagers to use trapdoors would also be nice. This however might lead to some problems in regards to using trapdoors for their intended purpose, trapping/deveiving mobs and therefore also villagers. So this especially requires some carefull thoughts to not break more than it adds.

Being able to craft regular doors/trapdoors/fence gates into variants that are inoperable by villagers is a feasible solution. Perhaps the opposite could also be an option. Make villagers unable to operate regular doors/trapdoors/fence gates and only be able to operate ones that has been marked as "villager doors" perhaps by crafting a door together with an emerald. This would ofcourse require naturally generated doors in villages to be of this new type.

Anyways, I would love for villagers to be able to uttilize these in their normal pathfinding :)
Instead of lock doors, why not just use the iron variants?
Villagers should attempt to sleep in the bed closest to their job site block. Currently I have (eg) Farmers sleeping in the bed at the Weaponsmith's house.
noooooo i use fence gates to keep villagers out of my basis in villages but the climbing ladders is good since they have ladders in villages .
I've been wanting villagers to be able to open gates for a long time now. It doesn't make sense to me that there can be a Shepard villager but they can't open the gates to get to their flock?

First off, I agree that zombie villagers should be able to become drowned just like any other zombie.  I just disagree with your reasoning.

The thing is, it's not really a choice.  It's a lot more efficient to do a farm based on natural drowned spawns than it is to set up a village breeder, turn those villagers into zombies, and then drown those zombies.  And if you're a Java player, the same thing that broke zombie spawner based drowned farms (converted zombies not gaining the drowned held items) would also apply to converted zombie villagers.  (I don't play Java, so I don't know if that change is still in effect or if it was only for a few snapshots)

To me, the reasoning to do it is that zombie villagers are natural zombie spawns, and it would be strange if they just randomly didn't convert.

I really don't like this idea. Drowns are irreversible. I prefer to keep my Zombie Villsger farm in tact. I already hate the fact that Husks themselves turn into zombies and then into Drowned. I don't want another farm turning to trash because of an official update.

I agree with clayGoddessSari that it would be logical, after all they are zombies. Although it is a really exciting feature for dehydrated zombies to rehydrate then drown, what would stop a zombie villager from drowning? It is a very convenient to separate the two.
I thank that zombie villagers shoud'nt becuse that doest'nt make sence

It would be better if there was Drowned Zombie Villagers they're drowneds but with the shape of a villager it would make more sense. It would be cool if you can found them near (or in) underwater ruins, adding a lot to the Minecraft lore.

I would like zombie villagers to get their own variants, whether they are drowned or something else. I like how certain mobs change into others under certain circumstances, and it is a little sad that zombie villagers don't have this feature.
Then we should also make it possible to convert Drowned Villagers. This time using a potion of water breathing, a otion of weakness, and a golden apple.
To change them back you need a potion of water breathing

I don't support the addition of teacher villagers. A good villager has several things that they can buy and sell, so a villager that only sells you books would be kind of useless and a misfit.

However, the ability to somehow teach the player, in-game, about biomes, dimensions, mobs, history, etc. is a fairly good idea. Perhaps instead you could get these books as a prize for unlocking certain advancements? For example, getting the obsidian advancement could unlock a book describing how to access the Nether and what there is to find there (Nether Fortresses).

This is a very good concept! We definitely need an in-game guide to read. To get the book the player should only need to trade some paper for it. No emeralds required. This would make it easier for new players to obtain!
I think a teachers a great recomendation but they cant just be plain books how about enchanted books

I really like this idea. It could help new players become acclimated to the game in a much more enjoyable way than browsing through the Wiki.  Many people don't have the patience to look up everything on Wiki in order to learn the intricacies of this awesome game. Please add this feature!
I think this is a great idea. However, I don't agree with this villager selling history books as it takes the fun of observing things to come up with lore away.
perhaps instead of adding a new job just have the librarians teach the villagers, maybe tell stories or something

I see why you think this would be a good idea, but I strongly disagree with it. I didn't really have anyone to teach me how to play Minecraft when I was younger, and had to pick up on all the game's mechanics from personal experience or watching my older brother play it. The game just doesn't work without the players improving through trial and error.
I would love that

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.  

 

Title: ‚ÄúNON-ANIMAL ACCOMPANYING (INTERACTIVE HUMAN, NON-PLAYER)‚Äù  

 

Text: ‚ÄúALWAYS IN MINECRAFT BETA,BEDROOK, JAVA, APK, ETC. YOU WALK ALONE, YOU EAT ALONE, YOU WIN ALONE, YOU DO EVERYTHING ALONE, I PROPOSE THAT THERE MUST BE SOME KIND OF NON-ANIMAL COMPANION AND NOT A PLAYER, BUT HUMANOID AS A BOT THAT HELPS YOU WITH WINNING MINECRAFT AND NOT JUST SPENDING THE WHOLE LIFE OF MINECRAFT.

OF COURSE IF YOU DON'T HAVE FRIENDS, THEN YOU FIND YOURSELF ALONE.‚Äù

Quiero hacer un amigo
No puedo jugar multi jugador
Yes
Are the all caps really necessary?
Great idea üëç
How about adding the maps to the bartering loot table? Seems more appropriate to get it in the Nether
Good idea. Might also recommend just a unique way that helps find these nether structures

Agreed. If maps in the Nether become functional, they should show Nether biomes. Since maps cannot calculate the Nether's terrain, they should at least tell you which biomes are nearby. I also agree with ProCheetah91163 that maps to fortresses and bastions be added to piglin bartering.

Map in nether is useless as you can see nothing, also you cannot use compass too.
‚Ä¢ If you use a map/locater on a nether what you will see is the top of the nether.

Explorer maps can still tell the location of biomes, like rivers, oceans, and swamps. Also you can use lodestone compasses in the Nether. It shouldn‚Äôt be too hard to implement different colored overlays for different Nether biomes.

Nether maps would be really handy in with the new nether biomes. They could be made out of some strange nether materials.

I know rendering it from top down wouldn't work because of the ceiling, what if instead the biomes had indicative color and the shade from light to dark represented the ratio of air to solid.

I think adding a Lodestone to this structures will be a more fitting thing and the compasses coneccted to this Lodestones would be barted by piglins. This would make it different to the overworld but it will still make sense because there¬¥s no paper on the nether and because Lodestones are made of netherite.

I like this idea, but maybe instead the Villager that provides these would spawn in the Nether, since it makes more sense for a Villager native to the Nether to be able to survive rather than an ordinary Cartographer.

 

Also, since sugar cane is not native to the Nether and cannot be grown, there would be a lack of paper. I propose that instead said Villager would provide a compass linked to a lodestone, with the lore explaining as such.
Personally I think you should get nether based maps from bartering with piglins instead of off the cartographer as it means you would need to go to the nether to get the map.

Another option could be to add lodestones at the center of nether structures (fortresses and bastions), then acquire the corresponding enchanted compass either through bartering or through trading with a cartographer. Each compass would be linked to a certain lodestone, similar to how buried treasure maps link to buried chests. This way you make use of a recently implemented mechanic, and get a "free" lodestone (these things are seriously expensive right now!)

The structures should have lodestones in them, and piglins should sell a lodestone connected to the nearest fortress. This would be very useful for speedrunning. These should definitely be implemented to fortresses but maybe not bastions

I have not ever made an eye of ender, I would like to go to a stronghold ligit in survivul without using creats, I want to beat the ender dragon at least once this year. And what doesn't help is the fact that I constantly spawn in the nether in random edges in the nether that aren't connected to anywhere, or maybe the piglins or the clerics could also cell blaze rods or powder. Or  maybe just make bastions and netherfortresses spawn quite close to nether portal spawns just a little bit hidden. Please make it eaiser to get eyes of ender. About 20% of the playerbase have acually even paid the enderdragon a visit. Oh and could you please make some sort of item that repels ghast from spawning, please they are so anoying (please don't make it too overcomplicated to craft like having dragons brethe because if you have dragons breath you wont even need to go to the nether again unless witches sometimes drop it, but anyway, just make some sort of map and make them easy to find and not needing to cross an ocean of lava!
the cartographer has never been to the nether so it doesn't make sense that they would trade them. perhaps bartering with piglins?
This is a good one as well
That would be such a good feature due to the fact that it's extremely hard to transport villagers and as you said there's not really a use for lllamas.
Adding on, you should be able to put any mob on a llama. And could llamas be made to follow the leader better? Currently they get lost too frequently.
Llamas + camels. Also the trading interface should be unavailable during the transportation, so that right clicking a villager would dismount them.
Or horses.

This is the best idea I've seen in a long time, it gives more use to dyed leather armor, to fireworks, and to banners. It also adds another level of depth to villages. Also... I agree that we shouldn't parallel any real world cultures, as too much could go wrong.
This would be super amazing! If mojang was iffy on the idea, they could maybe enable the festivals on certain holidays like Christmas oe Halloween, or some from other cultures.
Its a good idea.It would also be great if they parades in to 1 line by grouping themselves according to their professions or jobs.
And villagers could throw around different type's of food for different villages in different biomes.

Wonderful idea! It would add dimension to the villages and villagers. Also, perhaps they should not work (trade) on festival days. It should be a "day off" for them. Love the fireworks and decorations as well.

I think this is a really good idea, and I have a suggestion (forgive me if this has already been suggested). On these festive days, I think the villagers should have cheaper and better trades the same way they do when you gain the Hero of the Village achievement after you defeat a raid. Their prices should be reduced and they should also have new trades that they wouldn't normally give you; for example, fireworks, pre-dyed armour, cakes and patterned banners in exchange for emeralds. I love the singing/dancing idea! Maybe the baby villagers could have their own ceremonial dance? As someone else in this comment section said, I don't think these festivals should be too common. Maybe they could only occur on days such as Christmas, Halloween, Eid, etc? I know you said you didn't want to bring religion/real-life festivals into Minecraft which I totally understand, but if these festivals happen too often they will become repetitive which is why I think they should only be allowed to occur on certain days of the year. Maybe Minecraft could have a feature where you register the date of your birthday into the game (you don't have to specify the year), and on that day, there are festivals in the villages? There should also be an achievement that the player gains after they enter a village with a festival going on.

I'll appreciate if you give this comment a vote if you agree with any of my points, thank you!
Baby or teen villagers doing things like breaking a window stealing things from the market and getting caught add things that make the village more alive

Maybe more advanced villages like maybe one with a castle wall or a bigger town or villagers with weapons incase the iron golem dies you can also give them more animations like them rebuilding after an attack or rebuilding the golem after one dies
Maybe a rare farm with one house a barn with animals and a fence
Maybe like you can see farmers farming you should see villagers in a boat fishing out one crafting or maybe a villager that can enchant things for you or going to library to get enchantment levels
More lively villages
This is the best idea I've seen all day.
I think evocer is already a wizard
Mabye the Illusioner could pose as a wizard. Full support!
Uh this trades with you

Please don't make the proposed villager trades in the latest snapshot. It's going to make late game gear extremally difficult for the causal players. Having to go to every Biome to get low level books is going to make it more tedious then it is now to get the desired enchantments. These low level books could easily hit the max armor stand combining limit as well in our attempt to maximize them. The change i would recommend is to gate lvl1 books behind the first book trade, lvl2 behind the second and so on, but not limited to a biome, and No Book Nerfing. Zombie curing should not be touched either unless the one cure is comparable to curing them the 4-5 times now.

I dont have words to describe how frustated i am with this change. Mojang added villager trading system to boost mid game to late game so the player could expend more time in more interesting projects, like building a base, a redstone or even a farm. With this change it ruins this hole concept. Dealing with villagers is already stressfull, but with this change we will need to transport villagers thousands of blocks just to have access to some books. And now because there will be no more efficiency V books we will not be able to craft a maxout toll even after all this works to get the necessary trades. Because the level cap of the anvil will not let it happen. This change require a hole overhaul system on enchanting mechanics, villager transportation, enchant table. Instead of a small update. U guys need to plan it better. Otherwise it will ruin a lot of players gameplay experience

Honestly I disagree with with this. I believe this change is perfect to finally give the enchantment table a use. However I also believe they over killed the expert level librarian in which my suggestion would be that there is a 50% chance for the master level librarian to sell the max level to their enchantment book with the other 50% to be the level below max level as this will make it not as brutal of a nerf while ensuring that after a little work a player can get the enchantments that they desire without it being entirely guaranteed or overly randomized. With how librarian villagers are now its far to random and tedious to get the enchantments that you desire however with these new changes and the small change I suggested earlier getting great villager trades will now feel more rewarding and less of a grind to get what you are searching for. I still believe though that the enchantment table needs an overhaul though as its far to random to get any enchantment that your looking for.

Okay, but consider that having biome specific trade tables ends having to reroll your villager trades over and over again. As every librarian in a swamp village will have mending at a master level there is no need to reroll their trades to get mending because it was already guaranteed. I think that's worth building a swamp village for.

Though, if Mojang is going to be adding all of these biome specific stuff, it would be good to have a way to find the biomes beyond wandering around aimlessly. Perhaps allowing the player to enchant their compass to seek out specific biomes?
I agree, and with how hard it is to transport villagers, I don't want to spend more time and more xp

The new trading mechanic shouldn't be nerfed that bad. Even if it was, mojang shouldn't add the cap level of enchantment.Combining multiple of book is real pain which lead to "To Expensive", also if you want specific enchant you need travel a hundred or thousand of block if you unlucky enough, just to get A book with "efficiency 3" and you decided to bring the villager back to your base which is super time consuming,this hassle bring us to next problem which is loaded chunk,this force player to load unnecessary chunk and it not good thing for player with low end device. Speaking of low end device if this change make to official release, this change soon will goes to Bedrock edition so how mojang gonna do with mobile player, the amount complain about lag or anything else will highly increase.This change is absolutely the worst of all time, I think mojang just make this game even more grindy and not all people had that much time to play game, progressing would be hard with this change. There's a lot more thing that you guys can do like, fixing bug that almost 8 years old but never been fix for a reason for example and maybe fixing the worst performance of the game.Mojang should make change that attract people, not to force them playing for hours,this update really messed up so consider change it or make some minor nerf with the curing mechanic or something.Make change that attract people so their money to.(the change of the wandering trader is only thing good in this update)

Why don't you make it were you bring a item, like a axe to a villager and he gives enchantments based off of that item and his level. Almost like your talking to that villager. It's hard enough to find villages in every biome and go back and forth home to each village to get trades.

It's supposed to be difficult and challenging to get those enchantments, especially the overpowered ones, especially mending.

This cheese has been effectively a bug for a long time, and it's finally being fixed.
This is the whole idea, enchantments should be more difficult to obtain, so that getting them on the table and as loot at least makes sense.
New Trading can be good for exploration, but at least add a way to copy enchanted books, just like templates.
It's meant to be harder. Villagers were never meant to be the best way to gen enchantments.

The only change that i agree with is how you can only zombified and cured them once, so you can't have the 1 emerald cost for everything.

The other changes are so bad, it's just so annoying and tedious and dumb. Not everybody gameplay is suffering/grinding. Some of us hv other things to do in this sandbox game!

I feel that even though things may seem too easy as they are minecraft is not about the difficulty it‚Äôs about the creativity. me and my friends all play on a realm together with an economy and we just like to enjoy ourselves and build and work but doing stupid stuff like ruining villagers is what could badly damage our economy and kill the server. We do not play so it can be hard we play to have fun be creative and have our own tiny economy. With this villager update it could quite possibly lower joy and creativity on the server and in general in the minecraft community. Thx

Why does Villager trading need balancing? It has gone back and forth and is now harder than ever

I have played Minecraft for years and I for one do not like this change at all, nerf the cure discount if you must, but don't change the whole system. If you must change things, roll it back to the way it was in 1.13.2. You could breed villagers, or cure Zombie Villagers and you had to take what you got, You could not change it by breaking a work station. What they grew up to be, was what they were. It is not super easy, build a trading hall, then breeding and choosing villagers to keep.

Villager have already been balanced in a lot of ways, Villager in 1.13.2 and before traded all day and night, they occasionally locked up but would unlock by trading a different item. Now they trade only a few hours a day and frequently lock after 1-2 trades, sometimes till the next day. People call that overpowered ???

Traveling thousands of meters out to trade for a watered down trade is not the way to go.(Highest Unbreaking is II not III) Most players won't bother. Who is going to transport those villagers with the nerfed trades back thousands of blocks to a trading hall that took weeks to complete, not me! And a lot of other players have told me the same. Please don't fix what is not broken, I think the cure in this case is worse than the illness so to speak. I love Minecraft and play it to have a good time and relax, not to get frustrated and discouraged, real life has enough of that.
Personally I like that you have to work more for mending as it's really good

I agree. This changes not encourage us to explore but only stress out. We went from get all the enchanment from any villager at 1 emerald (zombified and de-zombified 5 times) to find a swamp (that coul be 5000 block away), build a villager breeding, upgrade to master, an only for 1 book. It too much for only 1 update. And all of this without having yet an effective way to transport villagers in Java (is a nightmare that take a lot of time).

I think the solution could be something said before here in this post: duplicating the enchanted books. Could be expensive, maybe like this: in the enchatment table with another book, and amount of lapis lazuli and that consumed all 30 levels of experience from you (can place the enchantment table right next to an experience farm).

I'm voting for the Don't make unique enchantments for villagers in specifically geographic points" and NOT "for or at least don't make some enchantments obtainable by swamp and jungle villagers, ". These options are contradictory and should be in the same vote.

I like to stay in one spot and build things up over time.  This update will actively punish me for that.  Who cares if the current way makes the game "too easy."  People who think so don't have to use it.  Don't take a sandbox game and give it a "required" way to play.  I work a full-time job, being face to face with customers all day.  If I have to spend what little free time I have scouring the world to make just a little progress, I'll probably just stop playing altogether.

I forgot to say: There are other mobs that could wear shields, and sometimes use them. Those are:

- Zombies (Villagers,Husks,Drowneds,Piglins,Normal) (They could use them, but not frequently)

- Skeletons (Wither,Stray,Normal) (They could use them, more frequently than zombies, and normal skeletons with shields would be melee attackers)

- Witches (Only wear, but not use)

Well, those are the other mobs that could use shields. Note: this is optional, but they should have shields too.
Why do witches have shields but don‚Äôt use them? Should evokers then?
This would help villagers die a lot less, I like it!

Witches are a complex case. They can heal themselves, for that reason they could simply wear them to be similar to the other mobs, but cannot use.
Evokers truly don't need them so much. But for illagers like Vindicators or Pillagers, shields could give them some sort of advantage.
Villagers need them because they don't have a great AI, and also they are weak to zombies or illagers on spaces where Iron Golems cannot pass. 
Well, those are some ideas. Please comment here to improve them.

Also, currently a villager can wear a shield, but can't use it. 
How? With dispensers, having their inventory full first.

So Mojang, maybe they couldn't spawn with they, but at least let Villagers use them.
Skeletons that spawn with shields should be able to use them freely, though it should be rare, and zombies shouldn't be able to use them at all.
It should spawn rarely and villagers shouldn‚Äôt spawn with them but they can pick them up.

Have an idea for improving golems: there should be two types, village and player created.
Village Golems would only protect the village it spawns in, pretty much stay the same.
Player created Golems would obey the player. It could have two comands; "follow" the player and attack mobs the player attacks and eliminating need of leash , and "guard" the spot it stands in a 9 chunk square with ability to patrol, also if the player hits golem it wont attack them.
Their fighting could also be improved, but not buffed anymore, like they could block projectiles and take little to no damage so they can fight ranged mobs, and their swings hitting multiple mobs at once.
Also to differentiate Golems, the texture could be improved by them having a band/ sash accross their chest and waist; Village Golems would have colors similar to the village they spawn in like tiaga or desert, and Player Golems would have a white one that could be dyed other colors.
This would give players the ability to make an army, each with a color, that is effective to move and command but not cheap to make and maintain, and would keep the villagers peacefull, also decreasing the need for more freindly mobs and pets for combat needs.
